name: TheAtlantic
text: Unfortunately, a negative COVID-19 test is still not a free pass, reports @sarahzhang: https://t.co/WLBrw0m6wt

name: TheAtlantic
text: The unexpected turning point in Dave Grohl’s relationship with his father came with a furious runaway note Grohl wrote in 1985. "My father was my first, and best, reader. It was through him that I found my love of writing...as a rebellious teen." https://t.co/L7EFWjcPcN

name: TheAtlantic
text: Trump's Tulsa rally will be a safe space for him—physically, psychologically, and politically, @PeterAtlantic writes: https://t.co/t9g3lWTThH

name: TheAtlantic
text: Will anyone trust the 2020 election results? @IsaacDovere investigates: https://t.co/vYVwkztTjX

name: TheAtlantic
text: "No one suffers from the drug war more than Colombia. When Nixon declared the War on Drugs, it was abstract, like the War on Poverty. In Colombia it is real." @tobymuse spoke with @conor64 about the costly war on drugs the U.S. is waging in Colombia: https://t.co/XLHw7kVD7o

name: TheAtlantic
text: In the deepest reaches of history, Seamus Heaney found a voice for the troubled present, James Parker writes. https://t.co/QzTV5VXIP4

text: A few glimpses of Iowa’s landscape, and some of the animals and people calling it home—via @TheAtlPhoto: https://t.co/NbgCFjZUsk

name: TheAtlantic
text: “Touchy" -- A poem by Elizabeth Bradfield: "we say, when someone’s / sensitive. So touchy. So / dangerous and delicate and / ready to tip. Touching, / though, is sweet." https://t.co/jwcbKIBcvX

name: TheAtlantic
text: As companies publicly grapple with their shortcomings on diversity, Elon Musk, the CEO of SpaceX and Tesla, is missing the mark, @marinakoren reports: https://t.co/1EKyBt1zJ3

name: TheAtlantic
text: "America’s brand of urban inequality," @patrick_sharkey writes, "relies on ... barricades to ensure that all kinds of problems—of which aggressive policing is just one—are concentrated in particular places." https://t.co/oXTHmCyUxA

name: TheAtlantic
text: “Seek to encapsulate Florida in a single narrative, and you’ll find yourself thwarted,” writes @legroff. “We find our motley self-portrait composed of stories that shift like sand underfoot.” https://t.co/lOqHkdqY2T

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Trump and his allies are working to graft his own vulnerabilities onto Joe Biden, painting him as a feeble alternative to a president tested by the coronavirus pandemic and the economic tailspin it’s caused," @PeterAtlantic writes. https://t.co/1Q0lKn4aDs

name: TheAtlantic
text: Many are crediting K-Pop fans and TikTok teens for the lower-than-expected turnout at Trump’s Tulsa rally. @kait_tiffany looks at how fan accounts organize in support of causes before celebrities they love even say a word. https://t.co/HXNnkzboFV

name: TheAtlantic
text:

https://t.co/GSNgbdIJl4

text:

name: TheAtlantic
text: People are turning to colloidal silver to cure COVID symptoms. The reason why speaks to the confusion surrounding this pandemic, and fundamental problems in American health care, reports @olgakhazan: https://t.co/WfmjGVj1Fj

name: TheAtlantic
text: Bruce Lee’s mythology is such that pop culture’s interpretations of him have overtaken the man himself, @dannychau writes: https://t.co/54Aql2XLPc

name: TheAtlantic
text:
"I do not believe that a day has gone by since I came home, more than two months ago, that my mom has not cried."

In this week’s Dear Therapist, @LoriGottlieb1 advises a reader whose mom’s mental health struggles have worsened due to the pandemic. https://t.co/1IbroWendc

name: TheAtlantic
text: “Though no one would ever wish it to happen this way,” James Hamblin writes, “the pandemic could mark a chance to reexamine how much cleanliness is good for us, and what practices we’d be better off without.” https://t.co/lCJkoRxpyY

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @jameshamblin: Here's the first excerpt from my book! In the new issue of @TheAtlantic.  https://t.co/4VfV6YUpRO

name: TheAtlantic
text:
At his rally in Tulsa, Oklahoma, this weekend, Donald Trump again called the coronavirus “kung flu.” 

In March, Ben Zimmer argued that the president’s xenophobia is the latest manifestation of a centuries-old trend: blaming diseases on foreign powers. https://t.co/yjPvuVb2JP

name: TheAtlantic
text: "In a world where airwaves are flooded with authoritarian disinformation, the effectiveness of American messaging depends on the perceived credibility and independence of the messengers," @anneapplebaum writes: https://t.co/fa8G2IIejZ

text:

 This week @theatlantic: Healthy parent-child boundaries

name: TheAtlantic

text: "At the end of every day, I was to pose the questions to myself and grade my progress. I could write whatever questions I wanted, but I had no freedom from the daily accountability exercise. I had to do it," @jdickerson writes: https://t.co/huLEBZnzNT

name: TheAtlantic
text: President Trump was reportedly furious at the lower-than-expected turnout at his Tulsa rally, and there were signs of it. Andrew Ferguson analyzes Trump's caricature-like performance: https://t.co/PptrFiDtq7

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @SStossel: "I Believe Trump Is a Racist"

Lt. General Ricardo Sanchez, the former commander of U.S. ground forces in Iraq, publicly calls out the president for bigotry.

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The Trump White House sounds, in [John] Bolton’s telling, like a collection of soulless incompetents, perhaps graced by the presence of an exceedingly rare competent such as Bolton himself (also soulless)." @gcaw reviews Bolton's memoir: https://t.co/nFeS86M356
